item.title: Linkedin Login Hack
item.description: My LinkedIn account was hacked this morning. To my small reader base: If we’re supposed to get coffee the week of the 19th, let’s arrange where, by email.

item.title: Hiring in the Modern World, Job Hunting in the Modern World or How I Stopped Worrying and Learned to Love the Bomb
item.description: I’m currently active in the talent market, looking for professional opportunity, opportunity to use my skills for the benefit of society, and the opportunity to feed the family.

item.title: A Stolen Reading List
item.description: I stole this list from someone I respect on the socials. But since he doesn’t know I respect him, I’m sure it’s fine to stick on the blog for future reference.

item.title: News and Newsreaders
item.description: I’ve been finding my niche news consumption to be really challenged recently – requiring a lot of manual management of links and feeds and it’s becoming unwieldy.

item.title: Risk Roadmapping 101
item.description: Thanks Chat GPT! Making this blog post was super simple. Effective Risk Roadmapping Frameworks for Startups Launching a startup involves navigating a landscape filled with uncertainties and risks.

item.title: Podcasts and Personal Development
item.description: Here’s a list of podcasts and resources for personal development in tech and startups. I’m putting it here, so that I don’t lose it in the giant email pile.

item.title: All the Reasons You're Unemployed
item.description: A Medium post showed up in my inbox. I was job hunting, and saw a strong parallel. Edit 1: Before reading my parallel, I’ve been told it’s probably a good idea to read the original Medium article.

item.title: Star Wars Pricing
item.description: Ben Obi-Wan Kenobi: Let’s just say we’d like to avoid any Imperial entanglements. Han Solo: Well, that’s the real trick isn’t it?

item.title: Getting started with Hugo
item.description: I took the time to get Hugo set up to replace my long neglected personal blog. Here is the story.

item.title: Hardware? Hard luck.
item.description: To replace a really old Denon that finally gave up the ghost, a few years ago I bought myself a Yamaha VX-R675.

item.title: Four Words and Five Lines
item.description: The four words and five lines that matter in speech-writing. For those of you who give speeches, rather than just soapbox rants.

item.title: A Box of Agile
item.description: Just a round-up of the stationery I normally buy to help in professional contexts. It’s useful to have it all in the same list.

item.title: GOV.UK wins Design of the Year!
item.description: For the past several months, I’ve been working on building out gov.uk. More precisely, the Inside Government team, working up new product development and content transition.
